author: Baha'u'llah
source_text: َدَمِ، فَلَمَّا جَاءَ أَمْرُكَ المُبْرَمُ قُمْتُ بِحَولِكَ وَدَعَوْتُ مَنْ فِي سَمائكَ وَأَرْضِكَ إِلى شَطْرِ مَواهِبِكَ وَأُفُقِ أَلْطافِكَ، وَمِنْهُمْ مَنِ اعْتَرَضَ عَلَيَّ وَقامَ عَلَى ضُرِّي وَقَتْلِي، وَمِنْهُمْ مَنْ شَرِبَ خَمْرَ إِفضالِكَ وَسَرُعَ إِلى جِهَةِ عَرْشِكَ، أَسْئَلُكَ
translation: And when Thine irresistible summons reached me, I arose, fortified by Thy strength, and called all that are in Thy heaven and all that are on Thy earth to turn in the direction of Thy favors and the horizon of Thy bounties. Some caviled at me, and determined to hurt me and slay me. Others drank to the full of the wine of Thy grace, and hastened towards the habitation of Thy throne.
